definition: to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: The full cast will be announced next year and filming will begin in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 全体演职员表将于明年公布，并在春天开拍。

sentences.english: Saldana also confirmed that shooting will begin early next year.
sentences.chinese: 索尔达娜还说续集将于明年初开拍。

sentences.english: What I can't explain is why Loach choose to make it.
sentences.chinese: 我未能解释为何卢治选择开拍这部电影。

sentences.english: Use the right stick to crank up an effect.
sentences.chinese: 使用右摇杆开拍一个效果。

sentences.english: Filming for the new 10-part series will begin in March.
sentences.chinese: 新一季共10集电视剧将在下年三月开拍。

sentences.english: The costars start filming Eclipse, the third installment in the series, in August.
sentences.chinese: 他还说第三部《月食》将在八月开拍。

sentences.english: A film will be made/shot in memory of these brave fire fighters.
sentences.chinese: 为了纪念那些勇敢的消防战士，一部电影即将开拍。

sentences.english: Filming will begin on location in Yorkshire in June.
sentences.chinese: 这部英剧将在六月的约克郡开拍。

sentences.english: Hitchcock said, "Roll'em" and filmed the kid.
sentences.chinese: 希区柯克说“开拍“，录制顺利进行。

sentences.english: The movie will begin shooting in beginning of next month in State Of Louisiana's Shreveport .
sentences.chinese: 影片将于下月初在路易斯安那州的什里夫波特开拍。

sentences.english: The day I brought them back to civilization was the first day of filming.
sentences.chinese: 我把他们带回城市的那天就是电影开拍的日子。

sentences.english: A film will be made in memory of those brave firefighters.
sentences.chinese: 为了纪念那些勇敢的消防战士，一部电影即将开拍。

sentences.english: Everyone must be on the set ready to begin filming at 10 oclock.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都必须到达布景地准备10点钟开拍电影。

definition: to prepare to film/to plan a shoot
to start shooting (a film)/to invest in (a movie)/to put (sth) up for auction
cast and crew/performers and production team
to put the last hand to (a book, a film etc)/to finalize/to kill-green (a step in the processing of tea leaves)
to start an engine/to boot up (a computer)/to press Ctrl-Alt-Delete/to begin shooting a film or TV show
to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
to take a screen test/to audition/screen test/audition/tryout
to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
